UNIFAC (picmol.models.unifac)¶

picmol.models.unifac.unifac_version_mapping(map_type: str)[source]¶

Map UNIFAC version parameters to their corresponding ID.

This function retrieves a dictionary that maps UNIFAC version parameters to their corresponding IDs or data structures. The specific mapping depends on the provided map_type.

Parameters:

map_type (str) –

identifier to retrieve the desired mapping dictionary. Valid options are:

  • ’version’: dictionary with UNIFAC version strings as keys and version IDs as values.

  • ’subgroup’: dictionary with version IDs as keys and subgroup parameter objects as values.

  • ’interaction’: dictionary with version IDs as keys and interaction parameter objects as values.

Returns:

dictionary containing the mapped UNIFAC version parameters.

Return type:

dict

picmol.models.unifac.get_unifac_version(version_str: str, smiles=None)[source]¶

Determine the UNIFAC version from a string and optionally SMILES strings.

This function determines the UNIFAC version based on a provided string and optionally a list of SMILES strings. It prioritizes detecting “unifac-il” if any of the SMILES strings contain a ‘.’ (indicating an ionic liquid).

Parameters:

  • version_str (str) – a string indicating the UNIFAC version (e.g., “unifac”, “unifac-il”, “unifac-kbi”). Case-insensitive.

  • smiles (list, optional) – an optional list of SMILES strings. If provided, the function checks for ‘.’ in any of the SMILES strings to identify ionic liquids and force the version to “unifac-il”.

Returns:

A string representing the determined UNIFAC version (“unifac”, “unifac-il”, or “unifac-kbi”).

Return type:

str

class picmol.models.unifac.UNIFAC(T: float, smiles: list, z=None, version='unifac')[source]¶

UNIFAC (UNIversal Functional Activity Coefficient) model class.

This class implements the UNIFAC activity coefficient model for calculating thermodynamic properties of multi-molecule mixtures.

Parameters:

  • T (float) – temperature (K)

  • smiles (list) – list of smiles string representing molecules in mixture.

  • z (numpy.ndarray, optional) – composition array (mol fractions). If None, it defaults to values from PointDisc.

  • version (str) – UNIFAC version to use for interaction data, as well as R and Q parameters.

unique_groups()[source]¶

Identifies the unique subgroups present in the mixture.

Returns:

array of unique subgroup IDs

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

property M¶
Returns:

number of unique subgroups in the mixture

Return type:

int

property N¶
Returns:

number of molecules in the mixture

Return type:

int

property zc¶
Returns:

coordination number (set to 10)

Return type:

int

subgroups()[source]¶

Get the subgroups present in each molecule.

This function determines the UNIFAC subgroups from molecule SMILES strings, using the Groups class to perform subgroup fragmentation.

Returns:

list of dictionaries. Each dictionary represents the subgroups found in the corresponding molecule, with subgroup IDs as keys and their occurrences as values.

Return type:

list[dict[int, int]]

r()[source]¶

Calculates the relative size of a molecule. This property is determined by summing the product of each subgroup’s r parameter (\(r_k\)) and its frequency (\(\nu_{ki}\)) within the molecule (\(i\)).

\[r_i = \sum_k^N \nu_{ki} r_k\]
Returns:

array of r parameters for each molecule

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

q()[source]¶

Calculates the relative surface area of a molecule. This property is determined by summing the product of each subgroup’s q parameter (\(q_k\)) and its frequency (\(\nu_{ki}\)) within the molecule (\(i\)).

\[q_i = \sum_k^N \nu_{ki} q_k\]
Returns:

array of q parameters for each molecule

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

occurance_matrix()[source]¶

Generates a matrix representing subgroup occurrences in each molecule.

This method generates a matrix where each row represents a unique subgroup and each column corresponds to a molecule in the mixture. Each element, \(\nu_{ji}\), indicates the number of times subgroup \(j\) appears in molecule \(i\).

Returns:

subgroup occurrence matrix

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

subgroup_matrix()[source]¶

Generates a matrix representing subgroup IDs for each molecule.

This method creates a matrix where rows correspond to unique subgroups and columns correspond to molecules. Each element (\(j\), \(i\)) represents the ID of subgroup \(j\) in molecule \(i\). If a molecule does not contain a particular subgroup, the corresponding element is 0.

Returns:

subgroup ID matrix

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Q_matrix()[source]¶

Generates a matrix of subgroup area parameters (q() values).

This method creates a matrix with the same shape as subgroup_matrix(), where each element (\(j\), \(i\)) represents the ID of subgroup \(j\) in molecule \(i\).

Returns:

array of subgroup Q values.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

psis()[source]¶

Calculates a matrix of UNIFAC interaction parameters for all possible pairs within a given set of unique subgroups. This function computes the \(\psi\) matrix, where each element, \(\psi_{ij}\), represents the interaction parameter between two subgroups.

\[\psi_{ij} = \exp \left( \frac{-a_{ij}}{T} \right)\]

where:

  • \(a_{ij}\) is the interaction energy parameter between subgroups \(i\) and \(j\)

  • \(\psi_{ij}\) is the corresponding interaction parameter

Returns:

array of interaction parameters between unique subgroups present

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

group_counts()[source]¶

Calculates the total occurrences of each unique subgroup across all molecules in the mixture.

Returns:

array of counts for each unique subgroup

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

weighted_number()[source]¶

Weighted mol fraction matrix.

This method calculates a matrix, with elements \(W_{ijk}\), where each element represents the mol fraction of molecule \(i\), weighted by the occurrence of subgroup \(j\) in molecule \(k\).

\[W_{ijk} = x_i \nu_{jk}\]
Returns:

matrix of subgroup occurrence weighted mol fractions

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

group_X()[source]¶

Mol fraction of each subgroup in the mixture.

This method calculates \(X_j\), the mol fraction of subgroup \(j\) in the entire mixture considering the contributions from all molecules.

\[X_j = \frac{\sum_i^N x_i \nu_{ji}}{\sum_i^N \sum_k^M x_i \nu_{ki}}\]
Returns:

matrix of subgroup mol fractions

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

X_pure()[source]¶

Calculates the fraction of subgroup \(j\) for molecule \(i\) in the entire mixture.

\[X_{ji} = \frac{\nu_{ji}}{\sum_i^N \sum_k^M \nu_{ki}}\]
Returns:

matrix of subgroup fractions

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

group_Q()[source]¶

Retrieves \(Q_i\), the q() parameter for each unique subgroup from subgroup_data.

Returns:

array of \(Q_i\) values for each unique subgroup

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Thetas()[source]¶

Calculates the area fraction, \(\Theta_i\), for subgroup \(i\) in the entire mixture.

\[\Theta_i = \frac{X_i Q_i}{\sum_j^N X_j Q_j}\]
Returns:

matrix of area terms for each group in each composition

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Thetas_pure()[source]¶

Calculates the subgroup area fraction, \(\Theta_{ji}\), for subgroup \(j\) in molecule \(i\).

\[\Theta_{ji} = \frac{X_{ji} Q_j}{\sum_k^M X_{ki} Q_l}\]
Returns:

matrix of subgroup fractions

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

rbar()[source]¶

Calculates the linear combination of the r() parameters for each molecule, \(\overline{r}\).

\[\overline{r} = \sum_j^N x_i r_i\]
Returns:

linear combination of r()

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Vis()[source]¶

Calculates the volume term, \(V_i\), for molecule \(i\) in the mixture.

\[V_i = \frac{r_i}{\sum_j^N x_j r_j}\]
Returns:

array of volume terms for each molecule

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

phis()[source]¶

Calculates \(\phi_i\), the volume term (Vis()) weighted by mol fraction of molecule \(i\).

\[\phi_i = \frac{x_i r_i}{\sum_j^N x_j r_j}\]
Returns:

array of weighted volume terms for each molecule

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

qbar()[source]¶

Calculates the linear combination of the q() parameters for each molecule, \(\overline{q}\).

\[\overline{q} = \sum_j^N x_i q_i\]
Returns:

linear combination of q()

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Ais()[source]¶

Calculates the area term, \(A_i\), for molecule \(i\) in the mixture.

\[A_i = \frac{q_i}{\sum_j^N x_j q_j}\]
Returns:

array of area terms for each molecule

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

thetas()[source]¶

Calculates \(\theta_i\), the area term (Ais()) weighted by mol fraction of molecule \(i\).

\[\theta_i = \frac{x_i q_i}{\sum_j^N x_j q_j}\]
Returns:

array of weighted area terms for each molecule

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

gammas()[source]¶

Total activity coefficients of molecule \(i\) in a mixture. These coefficients are the sum of combinatorial (\(\gamma_i^c\)) and residual (\(\gamma_i^r\)) contributions, as shown below:

\[\gamma_i = \gamma_i^c + \gamma_i^r\]
Returns:

array of activity coefficients

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

lngammas_c()[source]¶

Calculates the combinatorial contribution (\(\gamma_i^c\)) to the activity coefficient of molecule \(i\) in a mixture. The combinatorial contribution accounts for differences in molecular size and shape and is calculated using the following equation:

\[\ln \gamma_i^c = 1 - V_i + \ln V_i - 5 q_i \left( 1 - \frac{V_i}{A_i} + \ln \frac{V_i}{A_i} \right)\]
Returns:

array of combinatorial activity coefficients

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

lngammas_r()[source]¶

Calculates residual (\(\gamma_i^r\)) contribution to activity coefficients of molecule \(i\) in mixture. The residual contribution accounts for the difference compared to the residual activity coefficient of subgroup \(k\) in the pure component reference state of molecule \(i\).

\[\ln \gamma_i^r = \sum_k^M \nu_{ki} \left( \ln \Gamma_k - \ln \Gamma_{ki} \right)\]
Returns:

array of residual activity coefficients

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

lnGammas_subgroups_pure()[source]¶

Calculates the residual activity coefficient (\(\Gamma_{ki}\)) of subgroup \(k\) in a reference solution consisting solely of molecules of type \(i\). In this method, \(\Theta\) values come from Thetas_pure() method, where each molecule is assumed to be a pure component.

\[\ln \Gamma_{ki} = Q_k \left( 1 - \ln \sum_i^N \Theta_i \psi_{ik} - \sum_i^N \frac{\Theta_i \psi_{ki}}{\sum_j^N \Theta_j \psi_{ji}} \right)\]
Returns:

array of residual contributions for the subgroup reference state

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

lnGammas_subgroups()[source]¶

Calculates the residual activity coefficient (\(\Gamma_{k}\)) of subgroup \(k\) in a mixture.

\[\ln \Gamma_{k} = Q_k \left( 1 - \ln \sum_i^N \Theta_i \psi_{ik} - \sum_i^N \frac{\Theta_i \psi_{ki}}{\sum_j^N \Theta_j \psi_{ji}} \right)\]
Returns:

array of residual contributions for each subgroup

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

GE()[source]¶

Gibbs excess energy of the mixture.

\[\frac{G^E}{RT} = \sum_{i}^N x_i \ln \gamma_i\]
Returns:

array of Gibbs excess energy

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

GM()[source]¶

Gibbs mixing free energy of the mixture.

\[\frac{\Delta G_{mix}}{RT} = \sum_{i}^N x_i \ln \left( x_i \gamma_i \right)\]
Returns:

array of Gibbs mixing free energy

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

dlngammas_c_dxs()[source]¶

Calculates the derivative of the combinatorial contribution to the activity coefficients with respect to the mol fractions.

\[\frac{\partial \ln \gamma_i^c}{\partial x_j} = -5 q_i \left( \frac{\frac{\partial V_i}{\partial x_j}}{V_i} - \frac{V_i \frac{\partial A_i}{\partial x_j}}{A_i^2} \frac{A_i}{V_i} - \frac{\frac{\partial V_i}{\partial x_j}}{A_i} + \frac{V_i \frac{\partial A_i}{\partial x_j}}{A_i^2} \right) - \frac{\partial V_i}{\partial x_j} + \frac{\frac{\partial V_i}{\partial x_j}}{V_i}\]
Returns:

Array of the derivatives of the combinatorial activity coefficients with respect to mol fractions

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

dlngammas_r_dxs()[source]¶

Calculates the derivative of the residual contribution to the activity coefficients with respect to the mol fractions.

\[\frac{\partial \ln \gamma_i^r}{\partial x_j} = \sum_k \nu_{ki} \frac{\partial \ln \Gamma_k}{\partial x_j}\]
Returns:

array of the derivatives of the residual activity coefficients with respect to mol fractions

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

dAis_dxs()[source]¶

Calculates the derivative of the surface area fractions with respect to the mol fractions.

\[\frac{\partial A_i}{\partial x_j} = -\frac{q_i q_j}{\overline{q}^2}\]
Returns:

array of the derivatives of the surface area term with respect to mol fractions

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

dVis_dxs()[source]¶

Calculates the derivative of the volume fractions with respect to the mol fractions.

\[\frac{\partial V_i}{\partial x_j} = -\frac{r_i r_j}{\overline{r}^2}\]
Returns:

array of the derivatives of the volume term with respect to mol fractions

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

F()[source]¶

Calculates the inverse of a weighted sum of molecule \(i\), where the sum is over the occurance of subgroups \(j\) in molecules \(k\) within the mixture.

\[F = \frac{1}{\sum_i^N \sum_j^M x_i \nu_{ji}}\]
Returns:

\(F\) parameter of the mixture

Return type:

float

G()[source]¶

Calculates a parameter, \(G\), related to the group contributions in the mixture. This method computes \(G\) as the inverse of the sum of the products of \(X_k\) and \(Q_k\) for all subgroups in the mixture.

\[G = \frac{1}{\sum_j^M X_j Q_j}\]
Returns:

The calculated parameter \(G\).

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

sum_occurance_matrix()[source]¶

Calculates the total number of subgroups in molecule \(i\).

\[\left( \nu \right)_{sum,i} = \sum_j^M \nu_{ji}\]
Returns:

array of number of subgroups in a molecule

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

sum_weighted_number()[source]¶

Calculates the total weighted number of molecule \(i\) with occurance of subgroup \(j\) for all molecules in mixture.

\[(\nu x)_{sum,k} = \sum_k^N W_{ijk}\]
Returns:

array of weighted sums of molecule \(i\)

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

dThetas_dxs()[source]¶

Calculates the derivative of the surface area term (\(\Theta_i\)) with respect to the mol fractions (\(x_j\)).

\[\frac{\partial \Theta_i}{\partial x_j} = F G Q_i \left( F G (\nu x)_{sum,i} \left( \sum_k^M F Q_k \left( \nu \right)_{sum,j} - \sum_k^M Q_k \nu_{jk} \right) - F \left( \nu \right)_{sum,j} (\nu x)_{sum,i} + \nu_{ji} \right)\]
Returns:

array of the derivatives of the surface area fractions with respect to mole fractions.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Ws()[source]¶

Calculates the weights of \(\psi\) interaction parameters by derivative of area terms for molecule \(i\) over occurance of subgroups \(j\) in molecule \(k\).

\[W_{ki} = \sum_j^M \psi_{jk} \frac{\partial \Theta_j}{\partial x_i}\]
Returns:

array of weighted \(\psi\) values by first derivative of area term

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Theta_Psi_sum_invs()[source]¶

Calculates sum area terms for subgroup \(m\) and the corresponding interaction parameter for molecule \(k\).

\[Z_k = \frac{1}{\sum_m^M \Theta_m \psi_{mk}}\]
Returns:

inverse sum of area term and interaction paramter for molecule \(k\)

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

dlnGammas_subgroups_dxs()[source]¶

Calculates the first derivative of residual activity coefficient (\(\Gamma_{k}\)) of subgroup \(k\) in a mixture with respect to mol fraction of molecule \(j\).

\[\frac{\partial \ln \Gamma_k}{\partial x_j} = Q_k \left( - \frac{\sum_l^M \psi_{lk} \frac{\partial \Theta_l}{\partial x_j}}{\sum_l^M \Theta_l \psi_{lk}} - \sum_l^M \frac{\psi_{kl} \frac{\partial \Theta_l}{\partial x_j}}{\sum_m^M \Theta_m \psi_{ml}} + \sum_l^M \frac{\left( \sum_m^M \psi_{ml} \frac{\partial \Theta_m}{\partial x_j} \right) \Theta_l \psi_{kl}}{\left( \sum_m^M \Theta_m \psi_{ml} \right)^2} \right)\]
Returns:

mol fraction derivatives of \(\Gamma_{k}\) for each subgroup

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

dGE_dxs()[source]¶

Calculates the first derivative of Gibbs excess energy with respect to mol fraction of molecule \(i\).

\[\frac{1}{RT}\frac{\partial G^E}{\partial x_i} = \ln \gamma_i^c + \ln \gamma_i^r + \sum_j^N x_j \left( \frac{\partial \ln \gamma_j^c}{\partial x_i} + \frac{\partial \ln \gamma_j^r}{\partial x_i} \right)\]
Returns:

first component derivative of excess Gibbs energy

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

mu()[source]¶

Calculates the chemical potential of molecule \(i\).

\[\frac{\mu_i}{RT} = 1 + \ln x_i + \ln \gamma_i^c + \ln \gamma_i^r + \sum_j^N x_j \left( \frac{\partial \ln \gamma_j^c}{\partial x_i} + \frac{\partial \ln \gamma_j^r}{\partial x_i} \right)\]
Returns:

chemical potential of molecule \(i\)

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

dGM_dxs()[source]¶

Calculates first derivative of Gibbs mixing free energy with respect to mol fraction of molecule \(i\).

\[\frac{\partial \Delta G_{mix}}{\partial x_i} = \mu_i - \mu_N\]
Returns:

first component derivative of Gibbs mixing free energy

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

d2lngammas_c_dxixjs()[source]¶

Calculates the second mol fraction derivative with respect to molecule \(j\) and molecule \(k\) of combinatorial contribution to activity coefficients of molecule \(i\).

\[\frac{\partial \ln \gamma^c_i}{\partial x_j \partial x_k} = 5 q_{i} \left(\frac{- \frac{\partial^{2}V_{i}}{\partial x_{k}\partial x_{j}} + \frac{V_{i} \frac{\partial^{2}A_{i}}{\partial x_{k}\partial x_{j}}}{A_{i}} + \frac{\frac{\partial A_{i}}{\partial x_{j}} \frac{\partial V_{i}}{\partial x_{k}}}{A_{i}} + \frac{\frac{\partial A_{i}}{\partial x_{k}} \frac{\partial V_{i}}{\partial x_{j}}}{A_{i}} - \frac{2 V_{i} \frac{\partial A_{i}}{\partial x_{j}} \frac{\partial A_{i}}{\partial x_{k}}}{A_{i}^{2}}}{V_{i}} + \frac{\left( \frac{\partial V_{i}}{\partial x_{j}} - \frac{V_{i} \frac{\partial A_{i}}{\partial x_{j}}} {A_{i}}\right) \frac{\partial V_{i}}{\partial x_{k}}}{V_{i}^{2}} + \frac{\frac{\partial^{2} V_{i}}{\partial x_{k}\partial x_{j}}}{A_{i}} - \frac{\left( \frac{\partial V_{i}}{\partial x_{j}} - \frac{V_{i} \frac{\partial A_{i}}{\partial x_{j}}}{ A_{i}}\right) \frac{\partial A_{i}}{\partial x_{k}}}{A_{i} V_{i}} - \frac{V_{i} \frac{\partial^{2} A_{i}}{\partial x_{k}\partial x_{j}}}{A_{i}^{2}} - \frac{\frac{\partial A_{i}} {\partial x_{j}} \frac{\partial V_{i}}{\partial x_{k}}}{A_{i}^{2}} - \frac{\frac{\partial A_{i}}{\partial x_{k}} \frac{\partial V_{i}}{\partial x_{j}}}{A_{i}^{2}} + \frac{2 V_{i} \frac{\partial A_{i}}{\partial x_{j}} \frac{\partial A_{i}}{\partial x_{k}}} {A_{i}^{3}}\right) - \frac{\partial^{2} V_i}{\partial x_{k}\partial x_{j}} + \frac{\frac{\partial^{2} V_i}{\partial x_{k}\partial x_{j}}}{V_i} - \frac{\frac{\partial V_i} {\partial x_{j}} \frac{\partial V_i}{\partial x_{k}}}{V_i^{2}}\]
Returns:

array of second derivative of combinatorial activity coefficient with respect to mol fractions

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

d2lngammas_r_dxixjs()[source]¶

Calculates the second mol fraction derivative with respect to molecule \(j\) and molecule \(k\) of residual contribution to activity coefficients of molecule \(i\).

\[\frac{\partial^2 \ln \gamma_i^r}{\partial x_j \partial x_k} = \sum_{m}^{M} \nu_m^{mi} \frac{\partial^2 \ln \Gamma_m}{\partial x_j^2}\]
Returns:

array of second derivative of combinatorial activity coefficient with respect to mol fractions

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

d2Vis_dxixjs()[source]¶

Calculates the second mol fraction derivatives of volume term with respect to molecule \(i\) and molecule \(j\).

\[\frac{\partial^2 V_i}{\partial x_j \partial x_k} = \frac{2 r_i r_j r_k}{\left( \sum_l r_l x_l \right)^3}\]
Returns:

second derivative of volume terms

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

d2Ais_dxixjs()[source]¶

Calculates the second mol fraction derivatives of surface area term with respect to molecule \(i\) and molecule \(j\).

\[\frac{\partial^2 A_i}{\partial x_j \partial x_k} = \frac{2 q_i q_j q_k}{ \left( \sum_l q_l x_l \right)^3}\]
Returns:

second derivative of surface area terms

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

d2lnGammas_subgroups_dxixjs()[source]¶

Calculate the second mol fraction derivatives of the \(\ln \Gamma_k\) parameters for the phase with respect to molecule \(i\) and molecule \(j\).

\[\frac{\partial^2 \ln \Gamma_k}{\partial x_i \partial x_j} = -Q_k\left( -Z_k K_{kij} - \sum_m^M Z_m^2 K_{mij}\Theta_m \psi_{km} -W_{ki} W_{kj}) Z_k^2 + \sum_m^M Z_m \psi_{km} \frac{\partial^2 \Theta_m}{\partial x_i \partial x_j} - \sum_m \left(W_{mj} Z_m^2 \psi_{km} \frac{\partial \Theta_m}{\partial x_i} + W_{mi} Z_m^2 \psi_{km} \frac{\partial \Theta_m}{\partial x_j}\right) + \sum_m^M 2 W_{mi} W_{mj} Z_m^3 \Theta_m \psi_{km}\right) \]

where:

\[K_{kij} = \sum_m^M \psi_{mk} \frac{\partial^2 \Theta_m}{\partial x_i \partial x_j}\]
Returns:

array of second mol fraction derivatives of Gamma parameters for each subgroup

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

d2Thetas_dxixjs()[source]¶

Calculates the second derivative of the area term of subgroup \(i\) with respect to mol fractions of molecule \(j\) and molecule \(k\).

\[\frac{\partial^2 \Theta_i}{\partial x_j \partial x_k} = \frac{Q_i}{\sum_n^N Q_n (\nu x)_{sum,n}}\left( -F(\nu)_{sum,j} \nu_{ik} - F (\nu)_{sum,k}\nu_{ij} + 2F^2(\nu)_{sum,j} (\nu)_{sum,k} (\nu x)_{sum,i} + \frac{F (\nu x)_{sum,i}\left[ \sum_n^M(-2 F Q_n (\nu)_{sum,j} (\nu)_{sum,k} (\nu x)_{sum,n} + Q_n (\nu)_{sum,j} \nu_{nk} + Q_n (\nu)_{sum,k}\nu_{nj} )\right] } {\sum_n^M Q_n (\nu x)_{sum,n} } + \frac{2(\nu x)_{sum,i}(\sum_n^M[-FQ_n (\nu)_{sum,j} (\nu x)_{sum,n} + Q_n \nu_{nj}]) (\sum_n^M[-FQ_n (\nu)_{sum,k} (\nu x)_{sum,n} + Q_n \nu_{nk}]) } {\left( \sum_n^M Q_n (\nu x)_{sum,n} \right)^2} - \frac{\nu_{ij}(\sum_n^M -FQ_n (\nu)_{sum,k} (\nu x)_{sum,n} + Q_n \nu_{nk} )} {\left( \sum_n^M Q_n (\nu x)_{sum,n} \right)} - \frac{\nu_{ik}(\sum_n^M -FQ_n (\nu)_{sum,j} (\nu x)_{sum,n} + Q_n \nu_{nj} )} {\left( \sum_n^M Q_n (\nu x)_{sum,n} \right)} + \frac{F(\nu)_{sum,j} (\nu x)_{sum,i} (\sum_n^M -FQ_n (\nu)_{sum,k} (\nu x)_{sum,n} + Q_n \nu_{nk})} {\left(\sum_n^M Q_n (\nu x)_{sum,n} \right)} + \frac{F(\nu)_{sum,k} (\nu x)_{sum,i} (\sum_n^M -FQ_n (\nu)_{sum,j} (\nu x)_{sum,n} + Q_n \nu_{nj})} {\left(\sum_n^M Q_n (\nu x)_{sum,n} \right)} \right)\]
Returns:

array of second mol fraction derivative of area fractions

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

d2GE_dxixjs()[source]¶

Calculate the second composition derivative of excess Gibbs energy with respect to mol fractions of molecule \(j\) and molecule \(k\).

\[\frac{1}{RT}\frac{\partial^2 G^E}{\partial x_i \partial x_j} = \frac{\partial \ln \gamma_i^c}{\partial x_j} + \frac{\partial \ln \gamma_i^r}{\partial x_j} + \frac{\partial \ln \gamma_j^c}{\partial x_i} + \frac{\partial \ln \gamma_j^r}{\partial x_i} +\sum_k \left( \frac{\partial^2 \ln \gamma_k^c}{\partial x_i \partial x_j} + \frac{\partial^2 \ln \gamma_k^r}{\partial x_i \partial x_j} \right)\]
Returns:

second composition derivative of excess Gibbs energy

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

dmu_dz()[source]¶

Calculates the derivative of the chemical potential (\(\mu_i\)) with respect to the composition (\(j\)).

\[\frac{1}{RT}\frac{\partial \mu_i}{\partial x_j} = \frac{1}{x_i} + \frac{\partial \ln \gamma_i^c}{\partial x_j} + \frac{\partial \ln \gamma_i^r}{\partial x_j} + \frac{\partial \ln \gamma_j^c}{\partial x_i} + \frac{\partial \ln \gamma_j^r}{\partial x_i} +\sum_k \left( \frac{\partial^2 \ln \gamma_k^c}{\partial x_i \partial x_j} + \frac{\partial^2 \ln \gamma_k^r}{\partial x_i \partial x_j} \right)\]
Returns:

derivative of chemical potential with respect to composition

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Mij()[source]¶

Calculate the \(M\) matrix with elements \(M_{i,j}\) from dmu_dz().

\[\begin{split}M_{i,j} = \begin{align} \begin{cases} & \frac{\partial \mu_i}{\partial x_j}, & \text{if } i = j \\ & \frac{\partial \mu_i}{\partial x_j} - \frac{\partial \mu_i}{\partial x_{N-1}} - \frac{\partial \mu_{N-1}}{\partial x_j} + \frac{\partial \mu_{N-1}}{\partial x_{N-1}}, & \text{if } i \neq j \\ \end{cases} \end{align}\end{split}\]
Returns:

\(M\) matrix from second derivative of Gibbs mixing free energy with respect to mol fractions

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Hij()[source]¶

Calculate the Hessian (\(H\)) of Gibbs mixing free energy, with elements \(H_{ij}\).

\[H_{i,j} = M_{i,j} - M_{i,N-1} - M_{N-1,j} + M_{N-1,N-1}\]
Returns:

Hessian matrix

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

det_Hij()[source]¶

Calculates the determinant (\(|H|\)) of Hessian matrix of Gibbs mixing free energy.

Returns:

Hessian determinant

Return type:

numpy.ndarray
